answers.answer: Yes you can have cysts just about any where.  Do you have diabetes?  Have you listened to your doctor and seen a dermatologist?  Try the dermatology forum too. Either way be sure and follow up on it.

question: For the last 2 years I have small sores on the outside of my breast.  They range in size and appearance but typically last for about two weeks.  It is common to have several at a time on both breasts.  The sore has a white head on it, sometimes drains fluid.  Sometimes the sore is red and sunken in, and appears to be an open sore.  This first started appearing weeks after the birth of my second daughter who was born c-section.  I was tested for MRSA twice both times negative.  The doctor says they are cysts on the outside of my breast and recommends I see a dermatologist.  I saw a video on IBC (Inflammatory Breast Cancer).  Is this possible that this is what I have or can you have cysts on the outside of your breast?
title: Cysts on breast
